nodes.name: Replit
nodes.why_use: Spin up runnable projects in seconds; great for demos and classrooms.
pros: Cloud-based IDE with 50+ languages; zero setup
AI Agent generates complete apps from natural language
Runs entirely in browser on any device
Can work on phone and computer simultaneously
cons: Free tier limitations for serious projects
Can be expensive for heavy usage
Focus on web apps/PWAs, not native mobile
bullets: AI-powered Agent — can build, test, and fix apps with browser testing

nodes.name: Lovable
nodes.why_use: Generate and iterate full apps quickly with AI scaffolding.
nodes.best_for: Shipping UIs fast; turning ideas into working apps.
pros: Generates beautiful, responsive web apps with backends
Great for fast iteration and prototyping
cons: Web-only focus; no native mobile
Credits can burn quickly on complex projects
Less control over structure vs traditional IDEs
Customization is more limited

nodes.name: Vibe Code
nodes.why_use: Rapid mobile app creation with AI.
cons: Very new; not battle-tested
bullets: Mobile‑first app builder for rapid creation
Cross‑platform support for iOS and Android

nodes.name: Codex
nodes.why_use: Recently getting revamped so will get better.
pros: Great value bundled with ChatGPT Plus
Good for coding assistance without strict usage limits
cons: Basic UI compared to dedicated IDE experiences
bullets: Works like Cursor Agent but you get very high usage for $20/month
While Cursor makes you pay for usage, Codex gives generous limits

nodes.name: Claude Code
pros: Superior contextual understanding; can work autonomously
cons: 3-hour usage windows and resets
Occasional hallucinations
CLI can be intimidating for beginners
bullets: Good at fast changes compared to Codex and Cursor
Better prompt, better output — be smart and careful with this tool

nodes.name: Cursor IDE
nodes.why_use: Integrated chat/agents in your editor with repo-aware context.
pros: Multiple models; agent mode for autonomous edits
cons: Overwhelming for complete beginners
Advanced features have a learning curve
bullets: AI‑first code editor with agent capabilities
Access to latest models (Claude, o3/o4‑mini, GPT‑4.1, Gemini)
Pricing: Free, Pro $20/mo, Pro Plus $60/mo, Ultra $200/mo
2025: New pricing, o4‑mini free access, enhanced tab completion

nodes.name: ChatGPT
nodes.why_use: Fast ideation, code snippets, and explanations.
pros: Most comprehensive platform with Custom GPTs
cons: Pro tier needed for advanced features

nodes.name: Claude
nodes.why_use: Exceptional at analysis, polishing, long documents.
pros: Best at writing compared to all AI tools
cons: Chat interface is fairly minimal
bullets: Opus 4 and Sonnet 4 — top coding scores
Tool use during thinking (e.g., web search)
Multi‑platform access: web, iOS, Android, API

nodes.name: Perplexity
nodes.why_use: Grounded answers with sources; great for quick research.
pros: Deep Research for autonomous literature reviews
Great for specific code issues and up-to-date info
cons: Coding help lags behind specialized tools
Can get expensive for heavy use
Customization options are limited
bullets: Good for helping learn and find things on AI since it's moving so fast

nodes.name: NotebookLM
nodes.why_use: Learn from your own sources; quizzes, outlines, mind-maps.
pros: Only uses your uploaded docs (reduces hallucinations)
Audio Overview turns materials into a podcast
Great for learning from any materials
cons: Limited to documents you provide
Basic free version has fewer features
bullets: Creates flashcards, quizzes, learning guides from your docs
Interactive Mind Maps for exploring topics
Pricing: Free with Google One AI Premium ($19.99/mo)
2025: Video Overviews, interactive maps, customizable difficulty

nodes.name: Google AI Studio
cons: After trial, charges apply
bullets: Gemini model playground for quick testing
Pricing: Free tier; usage‑based scaling for higher volumes

nodes.name: Perplexity Comet (Browser)
cons: Best paired with Pro subscription
Better alternatives exist for research needs
bullets: Use Perplexity as AI browser just like Perplexity rather than regular Google search
